overview_of_class: This studio course will cover the principles of graphic design as they apply to the interactive world of the web. Sensitivity to the visual elements of online interfaces will be developed through analysis of existing site designs and readings. Technologies such as (but not limited to) Dreamweaver, HTML/CSS, and Photoshop will be introduced through a series of exercises and assignments. Students will use these skills to conceive and create their own web-based final project. Students should be familiar with Macintosh or Windows operating systems. Carries science credit.
name: Designing for the Internet
subject: RTVF
